title: Why does Diana's passive show up as a debuff on her hotbar?

embed.description: Gyazo lets you instantly grab the screen and upload the image/GIF to the web. You can easily share them on Chat, Twitter, Blog, Tumblr, etc. Available for Windows, Mac and Linux.

body:
**I had to repost this topic with an image of what I mean because some people who are new to league don't know what I mean.**

Her Passive will show up on the right side of her hotbar in **RED** meaning she has a debuff applied to her, but it should actually be in **GREEN** on her hotbar.

I hope this can get fixed soon, and I also hope this clears up some confusion.

replies.body: Just use {{summoner:1}}  to remove it, duh!
I dont know i always thought the the buffs section was blue

Picked up and been playing a good bit of Diana lately and that has been bugging me.  At first I didn't know what the heck it was and why I would randomly get debuffed.  I agree would be nice to get this cleared up as well.
Yeah, This bugs me every time I play her.

Honestly... her base attack-speed is so weak that she might as well not have the passive and just regular stats instead because right now her passive compensates for a weird weakness that Diana isn't supposed to have.
I think it is to stop her from stacking attack speed. With lower base attack speed, diana doesnt benefit as much from attack speed as other champion with high attack speed.

That's a bit counterintuitive and/or restrictive though. Diana is a character that has a three-shot proc on her auto-attacks and a lot of sticking power. She naturally dives head first into fights and tries to assassinate a target, but she's gimped trying to tap into her more auto-attack oriented playstyle because buying Nashor's on her isn't as efficient as building it on Teemo, Kayle, Azir or anyone else. But they gave her a band-aid increased 20% attack speed as part of her passive, which entirely negates the point and misleads players into thinking she's meant to build some attack speed. It's weird.

It's because she was meant to be a jungler and they wanted to have as much control over her clearing power as possible (ex: AS runes are a lot less effective, but as a baseline Diana clears well). It's really just a lever to pull.

Also her base AS isn't really that low at 0.625
Just pink ward the debuff! Duh
